intro: Lippia stachyoides var. martiana, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardeners and herbalists alike.
